channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TN

item.title: Report E-2024010240
item.description:
Report E-2024010240

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 11, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN2055 had a loose valve during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel arrived and assessed the site. MSES secured the valve on the tote and a transfer was not needed. Waste accumulated was placed with waste from another job being worked by them in the same area. Crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report E-2024010278
item.description:
Report E-2024010278

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ARLINGTON
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 10, 2024, one (1) 330-gallo drum of UN2055 had a bad weld and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid South Environmental Services (MSES) to remediate the impacted site. MSES personnel utilized absorbents to remediate the styrene monomer-impacted roadway. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for terminal disposal. On January 12, 2024, MSES personnel arrived back onsite to complete the transfer of product into a new 350-gallon steel tote. Once that has been completed, crews secured the scene and demobilized.

item.title: Report X-2024010215
item.description:
Report X-2024010215

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking hazmat in fiberboard box found on loadside in tote. Package and all spillage was placed in another lined red hazmat tote and taken to HMPA. DescribePack: One of two 2.5 gallon jerricans lost 1.3 gallons of fluid due to a cracked cap closure and compromised/torn safety seal (under cap) due to a conveyor mishap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, ventilation used.

item.title: Report X-2024010234
item.description:
Report X-2024010234

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-18T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-20
  • City: CLARKSVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver states to BC that PH had HazMat staged on the floor and he moved to a shelf. He believes he hit a bump and it caused the package to burst on the shelf and leak in the van onto other packages. DescribePack: 1.5 gallons of Zep cleaner leaked from bottom of the Gallon bottles in fiberboard box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Driver was instructed to pull over and open the doors of the vehicle. He called the Emergency Response number on the HazMat paperwork but was not assisted. BC met driver and they were able to transfer damaged packages in the back of a straight truck. All cleanup materials were put in a bag and given to PDM upon return. After cleanup, driver did not feel at risk and continued on with his day. Upon return to the station, PDM - Kayla Hoback - equipped PPE (mask, gloves, apron, etc.) and put all damaged packages onto a damage pallet to thoroughly inspect each one. Only 4 packages truly damaged and the remaining were repacked and sent out to customers.

item.title: Report X-2024010298
item.description:
Report X-2024010298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-16T18:13:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The leaking package was discovered on the rollers in load area 2, where it was removed from sort, placed in a lined tote, and brought to the HMPA for evaluation. DescribePack: The caps on all the bottles leaked through the vent holes. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The carton was placed in a lined tote and brought to the HMPA. The amount of spillage was small and mostly contained within the carton itself.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Haz pkg found leaking in APA chute after being sent on overhead. Upon inspection it was discovered the cap on the inner gallon container was loose, coupled with improper orientation after being sent on overhead, causing the internal leakage. DescribePack: Cap was loose DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE and ventilation used

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box (UNPOP Y rated) with UN1230 Methanol markings and Class 3 diamond label found on HMPA staging pallet in lined tote. DescribePack: One of four 4 Liter plastic bottles lost 3.8 Liters of fluid due to a 2 inch cracked seam under bottle handle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned and ventilation used.
